tweets.author: 0xSleepinRain

tweets.content:
Hyperliquidâ€™s fully onchain liquidations cannot be compared with underreported CEX liquidations

Hyperliquid is a blockchain where every order, trade, and liquidation happens onchain. Anyone can permissionlessly verify the chainâ€™s execution, including all liquidations and their fair execution for all users. Furthermore, anyone can verify the solvency of the entire system in real time. Transparency and neutrality are key reasons that fully onchain defi is the ideal infrastructure for global finance.

Some CEXs publicly document that they dramatically underreport user liquidations. For example on Binance, even if there are thousands of liquidation orders in the same second, only one is reported. Because liquidations happen in bursts, this could easily be 100x under-reporting under some conditions. Source below.

Hopefully the industry will see transparency and neutrality as important features of the new financial system, and others will follow.

tweets.author: 0xSleepinRain

tweets.content:
being forever online is such an insanely gigantic mistake, its honestly fuelled by laziness more than anything else, u justify not going out with friends and doing stuff because "im being productive on my pc" when in reality u get maybe 1 productive hour out of 10, u just dont wanna make the effort to go outside

then eventually you lose all ur irl friends, get bitter, angry, join a groupchat of other likeminded bitter angry people because we literally go insane if we dont talk to people, have these people basically be ur only anchor to reality / society, and a giant echo chamber of insanity ensues till ur world views are borderline insane 

all because u were too lazy to say yes to playing football in the park

in a way, we've made life too convenient, we have too much available to ourselves, and in these instances its unfortunately human nature to go to the most *easy* way of doing whatever, even if it isnt the best by far
